snippet: If there is one lesson transit officials have learned from Hurricane Sandy, it is that in the Internet era, keeping riders up to date is just as important as tracks and rolling stock.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy has helped transit officials in the New York Metropolitan area learn that in the Internet era, keeping riders up to date is just as important as tracks and rolling stock; transportation officials facing the daunting task of keeping millions of riders informed of conditions and schedules that sometimes shifted by the minute used tools that included Facebook, Twitter, Flickr and YouTube.
lead_paragraph: If there is one lesson transit officials have learned from Hurricane Sandy, it is that in the Internet era, keeping riders up to date is just as important as tracks and rolling stock.

headline.seo: Social Media Strategy Crucial for Transit Agencies After Storm
